meanings.definition: A large number of insects or other small organisms moving together in a group.
meanings.sent1: The swarm of bees buzzed around the flowers.
meanings.sent2: We saw a swarm of ants marching across the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The picnic was interrupted by a swarm of pesky mosquitoes.
meanings.sent4: The swarm of tiny insects resembled a moving carpet on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The swarm of fireflies lit up the night sky like tiny stars.

meanings.definition: A large group of people or animals moving together.
meanings.sent1: The swarm of fans cheered loudly at the concert.
meanings.sent2: A swarm of birds flew across the sky in perfect formation.
meanings.sent3: The swarm of children ran excitedly towards the playground.
meanings.sent4: The swarm of protesters marched peacefully down the street.
meanings.sent5: The swarm of dolphins gracefully swam together in the ocean.

meanings.definition: To move somewhere in large numbers.
meanings.sent1: Tourists swarm to the beach during the summer months.
meanings.sent2: Shoppers swarm the mall on Black Friday looking for deals.
meanings.sent3: Students swarm the library during exam week to study.
meanings.sent4: Fans swarm the stadium to watch their favorite team play.
meanings.sent5: Birds swarm to warmer regions when winter approaches.
